Peanutz
Mais pourquoi est-il aussi mÃ©chant ?

Welcome to the 15th iteration of this thread! Ask your simpler game questions here, and see them answered (usually!)

We use a particular format, so please be sure to number your questions and answers accordingly. Also, please attempt to search the forum before you ask; the answer may have been posted in a previous thread. You can also refer to Mushpedia.

For those replying to questions, try to give accurate answers and to check your answer before replying if you're not sure.

Please note that this thread is not meant for questions leading to possible debates, to complex advice, or questions about the SDF.

Format Example:

Person with a questionQ1: If the ship moves, and we don't arrive at a planet, what happens to the planets we scanned?

(Person with an answer) A1: Those planets are lost forever, and you have to scan for new ones.

Before you post, consider this:

You probably shouldn't reveal too many details about your ship in your question. If your character isn't an important part of your question, leave your identity out. Whether you're Mush should also be left out, unless the question directly relates to Mush activity.

If people need more details in order to answer your question, they'll ask for them.

We've seen FAR too many newbies post things like, "I'm so and so and Mush, and this is what's going on on my ship." before asking a question...without realizing that experienced people not only read the forum, they might also read that very question, and might be on your ship. That usually ends badly for the person asking the question.

Q2 : How do you lower chances of panic attacks (if you can)? I don't know how I'm expected to deal with ~5 panic attacks every day. Is it accepted to commit banana genocide D15+?
On april 30, 2016
Peanutz
Mais pourquoi est-il aussi mÃ©chant ?

There is no way to lower the chances of panic attacks, especially as those chances increase with time. The only thing that lowers them is to have as many humans alive as possible : the number of panic attacks is collective, not individual, which means that they are spread among the living humans.

On may 1, 2016
[9338706]

Q6: What order does moral loss, health loss, and death occur at day change? For example if Chun has 0 moral and Day X cycle 1 begins; she commits suicide. Does this cause everyone to loss 2 morale or will they just lose 1 morale? If a character takes damage from an illness at day change, will they be healed 1 and then take damage, or will they take the damage first? Other example is what if a character has 0 moral but is sleeping in a room with Janice? Will they commit suicide at cycle change or will Janice boost their moral first?
On may 1, 2016
Dzanek

A6: If somebody has max in the end of the day, they won't get anymore on day change despite any random events that occur on day change (steel plate, room shake, fire, electrical spike, illness, injury) as well as self-healed illnesses on day change. So if you have low , first you're healed by 1, then some events might make you loss your health to 1 and you might get lucky due to day change that you missed death.

For morale, it's opposite - day change hits morale first, plus Panic Attack, if you have 0 then you die. If not, then you get morale bonuses. If Chun dies on day change due to loss then her MOH still works.

But if Chun dies on day change due to random events that made her hit 0, then I don't know if MOH works.

BaltisQ.8: If I Green Jelly a camera halfway through Cycle 6, and It is supposed to break 4 cycles later(maximum time right?), Will it break at the START of cycle 2 with a message right away? Or will it break halfway through with the message that it broke appearing on cycle 3?

On may 6, 2016

Q10: How many special action points (Pilgred repair, Shooter, etc.) can you store up before they are maxed out?

(Meh, I probably should've just consulted the Wiki a bit more. Shooter is max four, most seem to be max of two.)
On may 6, 2016
[8744424]

A10:

2 per day, with max to 4:
- IT-Expert:
- Botanist
- Designer
- Shooter

1 per day with max to 4:
- Tech
- Physicist

So, tech pointa and PILGRED repair points can be stored up to 2, others - up to 4.
On may 6, 2016
[6826491]

A10: Two days' worth, which is equal to how many you start with. Depending on the skill, it's either two or four points maximum in most cases, but it's eight for the Chef points. Each day change, you get points equal to half your maximum per each skill, immediately discarding any excess.

So, four Chef points per day, two shooter points, etc.
On may 6, 2016
[8744424]

A10 edit: (Couldn't edit in time: 1 per day with max to 2 for Tech and Physicist. Besides Chief points that are up to 8, yep. And Polymath increases max amount of IT points up to 6.)

Evalcat

Q15: Where is the most efficient place to put a second sofa?
On may 12, 2016
Cross

A15: There's no easy answer. It depends on the situation on your ship (are the Mush dead?), the character's skills, and their activity levels.

A few examples:

An extra bed in the dorm so your Shrink can dole out 4 morale passively per cycle.
A sofa for Raluca in her turret because Janice and Raluca cannot coordinate effectively to allow her to sleep in the dorms, or there is no Shrink.
A bed in the Refectory for the person who can pull the most coffees in a day. Or for Paola with logistics so her and another person can stay in the Refectory and pull coffees when the other is sleeping.
A sofa in medlab so a lethargic Chun and logistical Paola can give Chun 3-4 AP per cycle.

Logistics Expert and Sofas are a puzzle of their own. There is room for creativity and thinking outside the box. Don't ask what is most efficient, because anywhere you put it it's going to produce 1 extra AP per cycle, ask what it is you want to accomplish, and take it from there.

Q17? Which rebel bases are the best to decode?
On may 13, 2016
[8886413]

A17:
[link=http://www.mushpedia.com/wiki/Communi...
Generally, the bases from days 3, 5 and 7 are considered worthwhile, while the others are optional at best. Many people also consider day 6 (brainsync) to be a worthwhile base to decode, especially on ships with many non-gold players.

Of course, if Paola's help is needed elsewhere or perhaps she has more time to spare, then this can vary. Of course, this isn't the thread for discussion, so I thought I'd throw you a link to see if it helps.
On may 13, 2016
TeufelsAdvokat

A17:
Day 2: +8 glory
Day 3: +1 AP from rations
Day 4: +1 Blaster strength on expeditions
Day 5: +6 morale
Day 6: Brainsync(communicating without Talkie/Trackie
Day 7: +1 damage from Patrollers, +3 morale

The day 3 and day 7 base are the best here: At the point D3 is decoded there will be about 25-30 rations left, which is overall 20 AP gain for the human team. Most likely more due to expeditions. D7 is undeniably strong. Being abled to oneshot more hunters is generally great.
The day 5 base with 6 morale can be a lifesaver or just a huge waste of AP. Also take into consideration that inactives also gain the morale and therefore possible avoid suicide and die of starvation instead, which can lower the net gain. Or the ship may not even need it due to a very good morale situation.
The day 6 base is good, if the ship has many Bronze players as Silver and Gold usually keep their iTrackie due to its Tracker ability. Also allows you to communicate during expeditions. This one makes life just easier.
The day 4 base can be considered, if the ship has no Diplo. Although there's no hope for those anyways.
The day 2 base is obviously crap and should be done only, if you are trying to get the title "Communications Expert" or are a glory-whore.

On may 18, 2016
Chime

Q23
Fires can damage the hull but do they always damage it or only if they don't spread / break something else etc. ?
On may 18, 2016
Aceb
ChimeQ23
Fires can damage the hull but do they always damage it or only if they don't spread / break something else etc. ?

A23:
PeanutzNo, one fire cannot spread twice. It can either spread, cause damage, or do nothing. When it spreads, the second fire can in turn spread, cause damage, or have no effect. I would say that the chances are pretty equal, so it is possible to see the second and sometimes third fire(s) spread, but then they stop and either cause damage or do nothing.

It's Peanutz answer for one of mine question back then. I think it is enough.
On may 18, 2016
Peanutz
Mais pourquoi est-il aussi mÃ©chant ?

Note that by "damage", I mean all types of damage : personal injuries, broken or destroyed items, damage to the hull, broken equipment... A fire that spreads does nothing at all. A fire that doesn't spread can cause several things at the same time, for instance break an item, injure someone and damage the hull.

So the answer to your question is that fires can damage the hull but only if they don't spread (or do nothing at all).

Just for be sure: what's "silvermode"?
is she silver at begin of the ship (chosen 2 skills) and then become gold (choosen only 1 skill and not automatic fill)?
On june 5, 2016
Cross

Assuming you have paid for Gold, when Gold expires you are permanently in Silver status. Players who have never purchased Gold are in Bronze status. Silver status lets you pick two skills and use an iTrakie, and never expires. Edit: The implication here is that if the player was level 4 and in Silver mode, no skills would be automatically chosen because you can only choose two, though the player may have bought Gold afterwards to be able to choose a third (and fourth) skill.

factoryman942

Q46: Does Guarding a room trigger Trapper ability?
On june 18, 2016
sperbi

A46: Probably not. Traps are activated by room actions. Every action, which you perform on you or on other people won't have an effect on the trap, while the interaction with objects in a room (from wrench to patrol craft) usually activates the trap. These interactions includes actions like "Examine" and "Search".
On june 20, 2016

A47: None.
On june 20, 2016
Peanutz
Mais pourquoi est-il aussi mÃ©chant ?

There are pieces of equipment that can't break randomly, but sabotage or green jelly don't work on them either (cryo module, beds, Pilgred, Icarus, narcotics distiller). They are never affected by fire or electrical spikes either.

Mycoalarms never break randomly. So if you see a Neron announcement about a broken mycoalarm, it had to be broken by green jelly.

Q69 If a booby-trapped room is on fire, does the action report trigger the trap? If no, what about extinguish ?
On july 14, 2016
sperbi

A69: keep in mind that I answer just in consistence with the general mechanic of boobytrap and didn't try out these specific cases.

All room actions will activate a trap.
Report an equipment should be a room action, it should be similar to examine, which also activates trap.

Extinguish fire is an item action (possible with extinguisher) or a skill action (firefighter), which does not interact with a certain object in a room and therefore no room action and should not activate the trap.

No, it's two different things. When you fail surgery, the logs always say that the patient has sepsis. But it is a physical illness, that can be healed with the medikit, in medlab or will pills, and only humans can catch it for real (it is the same as expo illnesses).

Sepsis is also what happens if you have an injury that kills you if you get dirty. But in that cases, sepsis is not an illness, it is the cause of death.

On august 10, 2016
N_Faker

A116 To be part of an expedition you will have to be inside the Icarus Bay. If the planet doesn't have oxygen you are required to have a Spacesuit in your inventory to actually step out of the expedition ship(Icarus).

A116a Patrol ships/Pasiphae can also be used to explore planets. You will only explore 3 zones instead of the 9 zones the Icarus would explore.

N_Faker

A156 If you are asking for how much you can salvage per 2AP salvage action, then the answer is 1-3. There does not appear to be any higher likelihood to get 1, 2 or 3 things per salvage. So the average would be 2.

If you are asking about how much salvage you can expect then that will depend on the hunters you have killed on your current location. From what I have seen hunters and even asteroids will drop 1-2 scrap each with a far higher likelihood for a single scrap dropping. Traders on the other hand appear to drop 1 special item in addition to 2 regular scrap.

These are just my guesses by how much I have gotten when salvaging until there was nothing left, so it may be wrong. Though I believe it to be fairly accurate.

Q185 :

When hunter wave comes during Daedalus being stationary, they do not attack for one cycle.
When hunter wave comes after Daedalus movement phase, will they immediately attack on cycle change?

Conditions:
ship have avoided a wave of hunters before;
there was no hunters during a few cycles before ship moved.
On november 17, 2016
Peanutz
Mais pourquoi est-il aussi mÃ©chant ?

They attack at the next cycle change. For instance if you move on cycle 1 and hunters arrive on cycle 2, they will attack at the end of cycle 2.
On november 17, 2016
[8436632]

(Followup) As far as I know it's a bit more complicated than that. Please correct me if I'm wrong.

Hunters attack at the next cycle change when they just arrive. If you perform a jump afterwards and avoid some of them, those who followed will attack, because they already waited for one cycle. Hunters eventually catch up later (specifically these who came with waves previously) in addition to the new ones, with approaching waves.

The question is: will those hunters who catch up after a few cycles attack immediately, or will they wait again?

I'm asking because I recently witnessed a bunch of hunters attacking right after the wave came.
On november 17, 2016
[8744424]

From what I remember, hunters always wait a cycle if they arrive when ship is stationary and always attack on the nearest cyclechange if they appeared after ship has moved (if ship was trying to escape them and some followed *and* if there were no hunters before the ship has moved as well).
On november 17, 2016
Peanutz
Mais pourquoi est-il aussi mÃ©chant ?

Hunters attack at the next cycle change when they just arrive. If you mean when the Daedalus is stationary, they don't attack at the next cycle change, but the following one. Random hunters arriving on cycle 1 attack at the C2-C3 cycle change.


If you perform a jump afterwards and avoid some of them, those who followed will attack, because they already waited for one cycle. And because the game considers that they arrive at the end of the old cycle, not at the beginning of the new one. This is true for hunters catching up with you after you escape and hunters generated by moving the ships when there were no hunters. If you move on cycle 8 (either to escape hunters or just to move), hunters will arrive on cycle 1 and attack at the C1-C2 cycle change. Trax are different, since they follow immediately.

When the Daedalus stops, you can have two different waves, one catching up with the ship and one made of random hunters. In that case, some of them will attack at the end of the cycle, and the others will wait for two cycles.


Hunters eventually catch up later (specifically these who came with waves previously) in addition to the new ones, with approaching waves. This has never been proven fully.

[8436632]

That answers my question. Thank you Izpod and Pienutz.

If you have no diplomat or if you really need scrap, start with weapons. They are much easier to dismantle than cameras and alarms, although you will probably have to dismantle those as well if you lack pilots.

Items that give scrap metal :
- knife and blasters
- cameras
- spacesuits
- fire extinguishers
- drill
- microwave
- myco-alarms
- freezer
- scooter
- thick tube (don't ask me why)
- tabulatrix
- narcotics distiller

Of course most of those should only be dismantled if you really have too. Oscilloscope, Lizaro and sniper's helmet also give metal, but the first one is really necessary when you have hull problems, and the other two require scrap to be built in the first place.

Death is the only other option?

I will answer that in a bigger manner, I hope people will forgive me for making an answer to already answered question. Here we go.

As people said it is no-no. It's counted as surrender, striping your own team from victory. It doesn't matter if there's a real chance for victory, You played alone or whatever You think. You belong to "mush team" so You have to keep going towards mush objectives. Letting yourself be cured or even helping humans, which are You "enemy team", is going against your objectives, team, teammate(s), therefore it is highly unfair, not approperiate and against the game spirit.

Death is never only option. Situation You describe is similar to 1 human vs X mushes. (where X stands from 1 to 15 mushes). You can't suicide as human in that situation neither You can co-operate with mushes.

Both cases are similar. You can fight the person that is guarding You. Even as Ian, after 12 cycles, You can try 4 punches! 4 punches are somewhere of 4 to 12 points of health if I am not mistaken and You always manage to hit. Roomshake, electrical spike, Steel plate or everything together, can help You achieve your task at least in small way.

You're predator after all, You can always bite if they let You live long enough.
You're a human, You can always convice them with You bare fists!

Never surrender.
Never give up.
Go forward.

Let's say You have phagocite. (+4 from spore consumption), You can have 2 spores (3 at best if You know the trick), which is 8 or 12 additional action points. Let's assume, You're full on action points also.

You can try to hit 12 (no spores) to 20-24 times (with spores). Chun has armor and full hp, silver/bronze player = 14hp. Armor decreased your attack by 1. Chun is not a robot, so player behind her can't be 24/7. You surely can find a large window to hit Chun, or count on random event hurting her. With 2 spores, You have 20 punches, which expands Your chances of succes. (from 0 to 40 dmg possible).

As Raluca, You can dismantle freezer, they won't benefit from it. You can dismantle microwave. You can sabotage kitchen, so they might be risking being converted by eating a uncooked ration or force them to live on bananas. And I'm speaking about mostly capabilities of a bronze mush!

Most of things in mush, can be often double-edged swords.

Q204:
does anyone have a screen shot of how the logs look like before and after using "Defacer" skill as mush to delete the logs?
when the next cycle starts and complete logs of old cycle are deleted can others who join the room After the deleting have been done get any hints whatsoever that there is something wrong? and how can they determine that Defacer was used?
On november 26, 2016
sperbi

A204: in the cycle defacer was used you will see no log anymore, no new log will be produced from any action, but a message like: “The archives are scrambled, someone was messing with the sensors “(similar to this sentence) is visible.

The following cycle this hint won't be visible anymore, the log will continue to register actions, but all previous actions (and the cycle headlines) are still lost.

So in most cases you can notice defacer, if you realize that in the room log some cycles are missing (normally you can see actions of past 8 cycles, 16 cycles with skill tracker).

If it is non-crowded room it may be normal that you can't see the past 8 cycles though if no action happened there within the past 8 cycles (you entering room will be first and only action then).
On november 26, 2016
sperbi

edit: i am a bit unsure with past 8 cycles: it may also mean current cycle + 7 previous, check it out yourself
On november 26, 2016
Dzanek

A204:
Before using Defacer: there are some logs normally.
After using Defacer in the same cycle: in logs there's description "The archives are scrambled... Who's been messing with the sensors?!"
After using Defacer since the next cycle: there are empty logs until some first actions are made in the room, such as the game has just started.

When the Mush activated "Clear logs" then all actions that had been done in the room cannot be read by anybody anymore so if there's somebody who didn't read logs before the skill was used, they won't learn the logs anymore.

No logs made to the end of the cycle when "Clear logs" action was used will be shown including: converting someone into Mush under camera, extracting spores, hiding and picking up items, combat occuring, weapon used during the combat, demoralization, HP/moral loss, torture/confident/premonition results, entering/leaving the room and everything else that is supposed to be in logs, they won't appear.

Also all deaths (except Schrödinger) that occur in defaced room between activating "Clear logs" and the end of the cycle won't be announced by NERON. However, human outside the defaced room will receive in logs of their morale loss caused due to death, Gioele's glory gain when Mush dies, Mush's glory gain when Chun dies and I'm not sure but also AP gain due to Cold Blooded skill.

After defacing is done and no human was active during the time, you can still notice the cut out logs. If you know there were some logs before and they don't appear the next time you log on, you may alert crew. Remember everybody can see past 8 cycles, Tracker can see 16 cycles. As Tracker it's easier to notice defaced logs when you investigate adjacent rooms and notice somebody entering/leaving the room where leaving/entering doesn't occur.

Q227: Is it true that you get steel plated or Panic Attack more often with less crew on board?
On december 16, 2016
Peanutz
Mais pourquoi est-il aussi mÃ©chant ?

Yes. The probability is not individual but collective. First the RNG decides that there's going to be a panic attack or a steel plate (or more), and then it decides who is targeted.

That's why, on coop ships, humans have a high chance of getting panic attacks if there is a majority of mush on the ship.

On december 17, 2016
Peanutz
Mais pourquoi est-il aussi mÃ©chant ?
roobeeQ229: Will fixing unimportant things, like turret doors, decrease the chance that important things, like O2 tanks, will break? Like, does each thing have it's own break chance, or is it decided that some # of things will break, and then which ones will break are randomly chosen.

Fixing unimportant things increases the chance that other things will break, since the difficulty depends on AP spent. If you repair things, it will increase the number of AP used by the crew and make things more difficult.

Cross

A286:
As far as picking up items goes, they're all going to be pretty much identical except for the cat, which I'm sure you understand. The benefit to picking up your itrakie/walkie/tracker over and over is that your crewmates won't see anything in the logs. If you have not selected the Splashproof skill, you can shower your health away, made a bit easier with the soap.

Just be careful not to accidentally kill yourself, because I imagine oftentimes it might look like a suicide if you make a mistake.
On january 15, 2017
Peanutz
Mais pourquoi est-il aussi mÃ©chant ?

As far as I know, only the cat has a higher chance to injure you. All the other items seem to have the same chance of hurting people. If you don't want people to notice that you picked and dropped something twenty times in a row, the only possibility is to use your walkie, as the action is private.

If you don't have Splashproof, you can also have showers, since that is private too.

Iamp_Q303: Can someone give me details on how observant works? I know it detects covert and secrets actions, but I'm curious on when the Eleesha has notice something interesting appears on the logs for secret actions.Iamp_Sorry, I forgot to mention: Lets say Eleesha was already in the room, when would the observant public log appear then for secret actions?
(Edit: I do know you would see the secret action anyway if she was already in the room, but it seems like there are strange patterns where Eleesha has noticed something interesting... triggers upon refreshing the webpage.)

It can reveal covert actions that are performed when she is in the room. For example, if a mush spikes Eleesha or spikes someone in front of her, there's a 25% chance that the action will be revealed.

It can also notice a secret action that was already visible. In the screenshot, Terrence and Ian are in the same room, and Terrence's eating is made visible by Ian's presence. Eleesha notices it when she enters the room.

The message "Eleesha has noticed something interesting" is simultaneous with the covert action it reveals. It can't appear after the fact, it's always at the same time. For secret actions, it can be triggered when she enters the room, when she refreshes the page, when she does something, when somebody else does something...



DarkGlasses24A303/2 IIRC it was like 25% chance upon entering a room, it uncovers all actions excepting private and public.

No, that's completely wrong. She cannot reveal an action that was not visible when she enters the room. If a mush extracts a spore in a corridor, with no camera and nobody else in the room, the action is not visible to other people and Eleesha will not reveal it, even if she enters the room a hundred times.

And she can only reveal covert actions (not private actions like showering, or invisible actions like transfer), but if she is in the room when the action is performed.

[8744424]

A305: As I understand it: let's say there's a counter for days, spent on-ship. This counter increases (for +1 day) each D(x)C8 to D(x+1)C1 change.

When the ship ends for you (for whatever reason: you die/return to Sol/Eden), XP gain stops and gold days spending stops as well.

So, for example: you die D8C6. You get your last XP (or 2 XP if in gold mode) on C6 (I'm not sure if you get XP when you die due to cyclechange or not). D8C1 your gold days amount was reduced for 1 (say, you've joined on D2C4, died D8C6 => you've spent 7 gold days for the ship in total: first on D2 when joining and last - on D8 ). That's it.

What keeps counting after you die is only mush glory. It keeps decreasing until the ship ends.

Moscobitch

Q306 - If there are various players at the same room, and there's a room shake, will all the players lose the same ammount of ♥?

Let's say I was in there, and I lost 1 ♥ (due to a room shake), will the others lose 1 ♥ also?

A306
Room Shaking
Injures all crew present in the room for 1 to 3 Health Point
The log of the accident and the crew member who is injured is Public, but the amount of injury is Icon Private and may differ between crew members.
The public log: The room suddenly starts to shake violently. The crewmembers present find themselves thrown to the floor and bits of the ceiling have collapsed here and there. What a wreck...
If crew member dies, the cause of death will be: "'Injuries'"
On january 27, 2017
spacekadt
Moscobitch

Q306 - If there are various players at the same room, and there's a room shake, will all the players lose the same ammount of ♥?

Let's say I was in there, and I lost 1 ♥ (due to a room shake), will the others lose 1 ♥ also?

No, each person gets their own RNG roll for health lost. It might be the same, but it would be random luck if it was. If you're doing health calculations, you should always assume max damage unless you know otherwise (because they've reported in or because it was you).

A316: Quite sure the mission-giving is tied to the person, not the title, with the person being able to give only one mission per day. For example:

  • JS is inactive, so Gioele is commander.
  • Gioele gives a mission to Chun.
  • JS becomes active again, and gains commander title, then being able to give out a mission to Chun again.
  • Gioele brutally murders JS, but they cannot give another mission until the next day. Chun is saddened at the lack of missions.
